<<<code>>>: 
private int[] imageArray;
private int currentIndex;
private int startIndex;
private int endIndex;
private ImageView imageView;
private Handler handler;

@Override
protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
    super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
    setContentView(R.layout.activity_main);

    imageView = (ImageView) findViewById(R.id.imageView);
    imageArray = new int[3];
    imageArray[0] = R.drawable.img1;
    imageArray[1] = R.drawable.img2;
    imageArray[2] = R.drawable.img3;

    startIndex = 0;
    endIndex = 2;
    // Automatically start changing images after 1 second
    handler = new Handler();
    Runnable runnable = new Runnable() {
        public void run() {
            imageView.setImageResource(imageArray[currentIndex]);
            currentIndex++;
            if (currentIndex > endIndex) {
                currentIndex--;
                startIndex = 0;
            }
            handler.postDelayed(this, 500);
        }
    };
    handler.postDelayed(runnable, 1000);
}
<<<explanation>>>: This code will cycle through the images in the imageArray every half second. The currentIndex variable keeps track of which image is currently being displayed. When the end of the array is reached, it resets to the beginning. The Handler and Runnable allow for the images to be changed at a regular interval.
